lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Bot.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Bot.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you again my G");
System.out.println("Hello! I'm " + name + " aka ChatGPT on Crack!\nWhat assistance are you in need of today?");
// Check for valid index (e.g., positive integers only)
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + DukeManager.getItem(number));
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + DukeManager.getItem(number));
System.out.println("Give me a positive number man");
System.out.println("You didnt even type a number !!.");
// Remove the word 'deadline' and split by '/by'
// Remove the word 'event' and split by '/from'
System.out.println("I have your ass covered! " + tempTask + " is now deleted. You have"
+ DukeManager.getItemSize() + " items left todo lazy boy");
System.out.println("I dont get your command man");
public void setDone(boolean done, int index) {
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X
// All kinds of error handlings of invalid task format can be done here instead of Bot.Duke class
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Todo requires a description!");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("deadline requires a 'by' parameter man!");
Event event = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new IllegalArgumentException("event requires 'from' and 'to' parameter");
